attributes.action: Allow vaccinated travellers from South Africa with negative PCRs to self-isolate
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government has been touting vaccine efficacy to the degree that no restrictions still remain on home soil. When it comes to other countries, the UK has a grossly disproportionate treatment of vaccinated persons. Whilst the variant was discovered by South Africa, owing to class-leading epidemiologists, the likelihood is that it is already wide-spread and SA should not bear the brunt of restrictions. The travel ban is heavy-handed and alternative treatment should be considered.
attributes.background: If travellers have been fully vaccinated, they should not need to be placed into hotel quarantine. As a precaution, home-testing and self-isolation should be allowed.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588072
